{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3176348,"name":"gbuckholtz","username":"gbuckholtz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/9fc29f/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T16:14:44.099Z","cooked":"

Is there a way to limit the amount of memory that NetworkTables uses? As soon as our robot starts using cameras, the free memory plummets and runs out of memory. Only takes a minute or two to deplete memory.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T16:14:44.099Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":63,"reads":164,"readers_count":163,"score":347.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":432296,"topic_slug":"can-you-limit-the-amount-of-memory-networktables-use","display_username":"gbuckholtz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26197,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-you-limit-the-amount-of-memory-networktables-use/432296/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3176496,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T18:15:04.053Z","cooked":"

Cameras and NetworkTables are pretty much unrelated. Typically only targeting data and stream information (not the stream itself) are sent over NT. Are you doing image processing on the Rio?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T18:15:04.053Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":133,"readers_count":132,"score":31.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":432296,"topic_slug":"can-you-limit-the-amount-of-memory-networktables-use","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-limit-the-amount-of-memory-networktables-use/432296/2","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176504,"name":"gbuckholtz","username":"gbuckholtz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/9fc29f/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T18:21:38.175Z","cooked":"

We are using a limelight so the processing is done there. The results of the processing is communicated to the rio using network tables. When the cameras are not powered, the memory is stable, when the cameras are powered up, we run out of memory quickly.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T18:21:38.175Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":124,"readers_count":123,"score":29.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":432296,"topic_slug":"can-you-limit-the-amount-of-memory-networktables-use","display_username":"gbuckholtz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26197,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-you-limit-the-amount-of-memory-networktables-use/432296/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176518,"name":"Max Morehead","username":"Max_Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T18:36:23.483Z","cooked":"

Can you share your code? That sounds like a memory leak (i.e. a bug in network tables or your code). Though if you’re using Java it’s less likely you’d create a memory leak in your code.

Here is our repo. The main branch will exhibit the problem.
Machine-Mavericks/FRC-2023: FRC 7480’s code for Charged Up (github.com)

And to be clear, when you run out of memory, how are you measuring that and what are the symptoms? Does the robot code crash?

the robot crashes for sure.

You can see from top, we consumed all the memory 251M, and from /proc/meminfo we got down to 2.5M of free memory before the next memory allocation crashed the rio. We get a mem_alloc failure on the Driver Station. I don’t have a log for that handy.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T18:59:05.154Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":13.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":432296,"topic_slug":"can-you-limit-the-amount-of-memory-networktables-use","display_username":"gbuckholtz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53784,"username":"Max_Morehead","name":"Max Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26197,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-you-limit-the-amount-of-memory-networktables-use/432296/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176537,"name":"gbuckholtz","username":"gbuckholtz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/9fc29f/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T19:00:53.377Z","cooked":"

Something I don’t understand. When I use jconsole or visualvm the heap size stays steady at about 100M and the used heap hovers around 8M

That’s why I think that it may be a memory leak in the c++ implementation of the network tables.

Does this suggest that memory allocations total 770,048MB?

VmallocTotal: 770048 kB

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T19:10:18.744Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":33.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":432296,"topic_slug":"can-you-limit-the-amount-of-memory-networktables-use","display_username":"gbuckholtz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53784,"username":"Max_Morehead","name":"Max Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26197,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-you-limit-the-amount-of-memory-networktables-use/432296/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176555,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T19:10:38.520Z","cooked":"

Subscriptions on network tables is a fairly new feature. I believe your code ought to do the right thing, but you might want to look at Limelight.getGamePieceDistance and try using getEntry instead of a subscriber. How long does this array get?

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-03-29T19:10:38.520Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":62,"readers_count":61,"score":52.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":432296,"topic_slug":"can-you-limit-the-amount-of-memory-networktables-use","display_username":"Gavin Matthews","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":26197,"username":"gbuckholtz","name":"gbuckholtz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/9fc29f/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38743,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-limit-the-amount-of-memory-networktables-use/432296/11","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3176558,"name":"gbuckholtz","username":"gbuckholtz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/9fc29f/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-29T19:12:43.668Z","cooked":"

How can I find out how long the array gets?
Println?

gbuckholtz:

How can I find out how long the array gets?

Looking at FloorPipeline.py, it looks like the number of entries in the array depends on the number of contours of acceptable size. Given that your Java code only ever uses the first one, you might consider capping the size of this array before sending it to network tables.
